latestVersion.versionNote: Small changes to study description and references

fields.value: Ideal Point Estimates of Brazilian Legislators (1989-2011)

dsDescriptionValue.value: Files provided include ESTIMATES produced by combining roll call votes and legislative surveys, as detailed in the paper Distinguishing Between Influences on Brazilian Legislative Behavior.

publicationCitation.value:
Please cite this paper when using these estimates:

Zucco, Cesar and Lauderdale, Benjamin (2011). Distinguishing Between Influences on Brazilian Legislative Behavior. Legislative Studies Quarterly, 36(3), p.363â€“396

value: Roll call data used to generate these estimates are available in a here.

files.description: The file contains legislator's name, party, state, the share of roll calls in which his/her party was in the cabinet (incab), and ideal point estimates (with standard errors) on an ideological dimension (x1) as well as on a non ideological dimension (x2).
files.label: estimates_legis1989-1990.tab

dataFile.description: The file contains legislator's name, party, state, the share of roll calls in which his/her party was in the cabinet (incab), and ideal point estimates (with standard errors) on an ideological dimension (x1) as well as on a non ideological dimension (x2).

dataFile.description: The file contains legislator's name, party, state, the share of roll calls in which his/her party was in the cabinet (incab), and ideal point estimates (with standard errors) on an ideological dimension (x1) as well as on a non ideological dimension (x2).

files.description: The file extends the analysis to the end of the 53rd legislature (Feb 2011). The original version of the paper used data through Dec 2009 only. The file contains legislator's name, party, state, the share of roll calls in which his/her party was in the cabinet (incab), and ideal point estimates (with standard errors) on an ideological dimension (x1) as well as on a non ideological dimension (x2).
files.label: estimates_legis2007-2010.tab

dataFile.description: The file extends the analysis to the end of the 53rd legislature (Feb 2011). The original version of the paper used data through Dec 2009 only. The file contains legislator's name, party, state, the share of roll calls in which his/her party was in the cabinet (incab), and ideal point estimates (with standard errors) on an ideological dimension (x1) as well as on a non ideological dimension (x2).

files.description: The file contains party name, the share of roll calls in which the party was in the cabinet (incab) the number of legislators in the set affiliated with the party (n), party position estimates (and standard errors) in an ideological dimension (pp1) and in non ideological dimension (pp2). The last two columns (x1bar, x2bar) are the average positions of its members in each dimension. See paper for details.
files.label: estimates_party1989-1990.tab

dataFile.description: The file contains party name, the share of roll calls in which the party was in the cabinet (incab) the number of legislators in the set affiliated with the party (n), party position estimates (and standard errors) in an ideological dimension (pp1) and in non ideological dimension (pp2). The last two columns (x1bar, x2bar) are the average positions of its members in each dimension. See paper for details.
